channel.title: Cubans upset over Black Ops mission to kill Castro
channel.description:
Cuba's state-run media and bloggers are not amused at "Call of Duty: Black Ops," a new videogame in which the player can join a secret operation in the 1960s to assassinate former leader Fidel Castro. "What the United States government did not manage to do in 50 years, now it attempts to accomplish by virtual means," said comments Wednesday on the website Cubadebate, where Castro regularly publishes opinion pieces. The site was referring to the numerous plots to kill the Cuban president, which the government said numbers 638. The latest installment of the hit "Call of Duty" franchise went on sale in North America and Europe on Tuesday, ditching World War II and modern-day environments for a Cold War theme. The game's first mission is to assassinate Fidel Castro before the 1962 missile crisis, the moment when the Cold War came closest to tipping into a full-blown nuclear conflict. Later missions take gamers inside the former Soviet Union and southeast Asia during the Vietnam War. Castro, now 84, led Cuba from the 1959 revolution until he stepped down for health reasons in 2006. His brother Raul Castro is currently the president of the communist nation. On one hand, the game "glorifies the attempts that in an illegal manner the United States government planned against Castro," while on the other it "stimulates sociopathic behavior among American children and adolescents, the main consumers" of those games, Cubadebate said.
http://www.breitbart.com/article.php?id=CNG.b9761a6dd74acc50652592c49cffc83e.161&show_article=1 Talk about an over reaction.

[/quote]i know ur just trollin so i will ignore you

@ abatssk8ter: you made my day, thanks!

I was trying to see what hed say if he thought someone thought in the same way.[/quote]yeh i suspected something like that, you have plenty of views that are very morally questionable, but you’re not THAT naive

item.title: Cubans upset over Black Ops mission to kill Castro
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Girls and boys, today we will have a quick lesson on trolls.

Frell:

I agree a big nuke on Castro’s head would have been the best solution. We’d get rid of all the niggers in Haiti also. Its a win win.

This is an obvious troll, I can tell because of the sarcasm and bad method to troll with, and having seen a few trolls in my day.

[quote=“abatssk8ter, post:36, topic:368360”][quote author=Rixxx link=topic=464512.msg3403314#msg3403314 date=1290126315]
You’re an idiot.
[/quote]Communist?[/quote]

This is a genuine troll attempt, you can tell because from the viewers point of view you are unsure if he is serious or not, however the fact he uses already very stereotypical arguments indicate he is not serious.

This concludes our 5 second lesson. I’ll see you next week!

Read full topic

item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

cooper:

Lenin’s USSR wasn’t truly communist either, though.

Nope, but the general idea is that Lenin was going to make it Communist, but he died before he could. Whether that is really true, or Lenin was on his way to become a dictator himself, I don’t know.

item.title: Cubans upset over Black Ops mission to kill Castro
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Pretty sure Cuba IS a communist country. At least it was under Fidel Castro.

Theoretically, a communist country is a country where everyone has equal power. Because many self-proclaimed communist country’s are Stalinist, they aren’t true communist countries. The Soviet-Union, North-Korea, were, after Lenin died obviously, Stalinist countries. Countries where the power was in the hands of one single person. Cuba is a Leninist country. Lenin didn’t have all the power, his decisions had to be judged by the party.

In short, they are all People’s republics (Socialist republic), not Communist countries. A People’s republic is a political form between a (in the case of the USSR) Tsarist country and a Communist country.

Read full topic
